oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Nashville baseball team, 1908
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A postcard of the 1908 Nashville Baseball team, known as the Nashville Baseball Club managed by William "Bill" Bernhard. They were officially named the Nashville Volunteers in 1908 for the state's nickname, "The Volunteer State." In 1908, this minor league baseball beat the New Orleans Pelicans to win the Southern Association league pennant. The championship was won on the final game of the season at Sulphur Dell in Nashville, Tennessee. Forms part of the Nashville Room Postcard Collection. 1 postcard : col. ; 3.5 x 5.5 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Nashville Vols (Baseball team)
